page.title: 07BLACKMORE VALE MIXED FARMING
page.content: Nearly half of these acres are part of the private estate to the east. Uncultivated grassland with no cattle but 3 horses.A big dairy farm occupies the remaining acres which being above the flood level has been farmed for hundreds of years.Large open fields with trees mainly in the hedgerows are planted for easy cultivation and are excellent for fox hunting in winter. There is a fine avenue of trees near one old former farmhouse which has a large cultivated garden. This area is served by a secondary road Sturminster to Stalbridge but has no bus service.A car is essential. The few dwelling places range from old stone farms to modern bungalows but the local residents are either retired or land-workers.Most of the homes are oil-heated.Shopping in Stalbridge is the most popular.
